fontSetEncoding

public boolean fontSetEncoding(java.lang.String enc)
Description copied from interface: FontSource
Set encoding. Remember: The Font Source implementation must always provide unicode encoded chars. This is to set the encoding by the user if the file's encoding is not given by the file. So, calling this method forces the implementation to reorganize its chars.
Specified by:
fontSetEncoding in interface FontSource
Following copied from interface: ufolib.fontizer.FontSource
Returns:
false, if it fails

Specified by:
fontEncoding in interface FontSource
Following copied from interface: ufolib.fontizer.FontSource
Returns:
null, if default
